title: Why Basic Attacks Have to Root?
body:
Why nautilus basic attacks have to Root?

Isnt it enough with that big Q hit box and his Ultimate that stun multiple players?
Isnt it enough with the damage that he deals and his tankiness?

Basic attacks thats what they are, they shouldnt have anything else..

replies.body: Are you aware how many champions have on-hit passive effects?

I just love seeing the gank coming, predicting the hook, dodging the _most difficult hook in the game to dodge_ and then dying anyway because Naut blew his flash and autoed out of desperation.
Nothing like having a significant outplay erased by a passive.
If naut can flash onto you after everything then you really messed up.

> [{quoted}](name=Cind3rkick,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=4KbzKGr7,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-11-08T09:40:12.823+0000)
>
> If naut can flash onto you after everything then you really messed up.

What do you mean "can flash onto you"? Do you think it's possible to never be within flash-auto range? Especially when the enemy just threw a hook at you and probably pulled himself to a wall or a minion close by.
Even if you have your Flash ready you aren't going to be able to use it between when he blows Flash and queues up an auto attack. And flashing after the auto attack's begun doesn't stop it.
see that isnt my issue with Naut... my issue is how absurdly tanky he gets with minimal investment. literally one incomplete item of armor and mag  res and hes nearly unkillable in a group
He'd be dead in the water without it. Not every champ can have a hook that goes 20 miles and pulls you all the way to them.
